970017-d-03-04-97-WE.Narrative: THE CAUSE OF THIS DERAILMENT HAS NOT BEEN DETERMINED.  THE TRAIN WAS MADE UP AS FOLLOWS:  CONTROLLING ENGINE WE 3016 ON THE HEAD END WITH THE CREW ON BOARD, FOLLOWED BY FIVE LOADS AND THREE EMPTIES, FOLLOWED BY ENGINE 2713 WHICH WAS UNOCCUPPIED AT THE REAR OF THE TRAIN. THE CREW WAS UNAWARE THAT ANYEQUIPMENT HAD DERAILED UNTIL THE CONDUCTOR DISMOUNTED THE TRAIN TO LINE THE MAIN TRACK SWITCH AT PIERCE AND DISCOVERED THAT THE ENGINE BEING HAULED AT THE REAR OF THE TRAIN, WE 2713, HAD DERAILED ALLWHEELS AND THAT ONE CAR, TTPX 80012, HAD DERAILED L1 AND L2 WHEELS.  THE CONDUCTOR IMMEDIATELY STOPPED THE MOVEMENT.  THE TRAIN CREW HAD PERFORMED A COMPLETE AIR TEST BEFORE DEPARTING CLAIRTON.  NO AIR HOSES WERE SEPARATED AND THE TRAIN DID NOT GO INTO EMERGENCY.  THERE WAS 4,650 FEET OF TRACK DAMAGE.  THE TRACK HAS NOT BEEN REPAIRED TO DATE.  THE TRACK DAMAGE IS AN ESTIMATE DERIVED BY USING THEFIGURE OF $10 PER TRACK FOOT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

PI97007-d-03-12-97-WE.Narrative: A PRIVATE, NON-RAILROAD, CONTRACTOR WAS WORKING IN THE AREA OF A PRIVATE CROSSING.  THE CONTRACTOR'SDUMP TRUCK, PARTLY LOADED WITH DIRT, BACKED ACROSS THE TRACK IN CLOSE PROXIMITY TO A TRAIN MOVING AT 7 MPH.  THE CONDUCTOR ALERTED THE ENGINEER, WHO THEN PLACED THE TRAIN IN EMERGENCY. A BRAKEMAN, WHO WAS RIDING ON THE LAST CAR, CLAIMED AN INJURY WHEN THE SLACK BUNCHED SUDDENLY AND CAUSED HIM TO CONTACT THE HAND RAILING ON THE LAST CAR. SEE ALSO THE 55A FORM AND THE 57 FORM FOR THIS SAME INCIDENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4081-d-03-12-97-WC.Narrative: TRAIN SPEM-06 CONSISTING OF 4 LOCOMOTIVES AND 107 EMPTIES WAS STARTING OUT FROM A STOP WITH THEIR TRAIN STRETCHED GOING UP HILL. THE ENGINEER HAD INCREASED THE AIR AND STARTED TO PULL WHEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. G4082-d-03-20-97-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Shoving movement, man on or at leading end of movement, failure to control
G4082-d-03-20-97-WC.Accident Cause: Shoving movement, man on or at leading end of movement, failure to control
G4082-d-03-20-97-WC.Narrative: THE 2200 WEST PULL DOWN WAS PERFOMING SWITCHING DUTIES IN THE FOND DU LAC YARD ON TRACK 54. THE CREWWAS SHOVING 66 CARS, AT A SPEED OF 13.1 MPH, INTO 53 CARS THAT WERE STANDING ON TRACK 54 TO MAKE AJOINT. THE CONDUCTOR WAS ON THE GROUND STANDING AT THE JOINT AND TOLD THE ENGINEER TO COME BACK 10 CARS. WHEN ALL OF A SUDDEN THE CONDUCTOR NOTICED THEY WERE 3 CARS AWAY HE CALLED OUT "THAT'LL DO". THE EINGINEER PLUGGED THE TRAIN BUT DUE TO BEING TOO CLOSE AND GOING TOO FAST, HIT THE STANDING CARS WITH TOO MUCH FORCE CAUSING 3 CARS TO DERAIL AND DAMAGE TO ANOTHER CAR IN THEIR TRAIN. THE HIGH IMPACT SHOVED 2 OF THE 3 DERAILED CARS ONTO THE TOP OF CARS THAT WERE STANDING ON TRACKS 55 & 56. THE CARS ON TRACKS 55 & 56 WERE NOT DERAILED BUT DID SUSTAIN DAMAGE. A TOTAL OF 3 CARS ON TRACK 55 WERE DAMAGED AND 1 CAR ON TRACK 56. A CAR ON TRACK 63 ALSO SUSTAINED DAMAGE WHEN A TRUCK ENDED UP UNDENEATHIT. THE CREW DID UNDERGO FRA POST ACCIDENT TESTING AND ALL TESTS WERE NEGATIVE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

97MAR01-d-03-25-97-PTRA.Narrative: JOB 132 WAS SWITCHING THE FIRST CUT OUT OF TRACK 101.  SWITCHING ON THE FIRST CUT, THEY KICKED 10 EMPTY HOPPER CARS TO TRACK 13, THE CARS WENT TO THE JOINT AND ROLLED IN THE TRACK ABOUT A AND 1/2 CARLENGTHS.  JOB 132 THEN WENT TO TRACK 101 AND PICKED UP THEIR SECOND CUT.  AS THEY BEGAN SWITCHING, THEY HAD A CAR MARKED TO TRACK 12.  THE FIELDMAN HAD LINED THE 12 SWITCH AFTER THE CARS GOING INTO TRACK 13 HAD CLEARED.  AS THE EMPTY TANK CAR GATX 89322 WENT INTO TRACK 12, IT CORNERED THE EMPTY HOPPER CAR CNW 174542, WHICH HAD ROLLED BACK IN TRACK 13 TO FOUL TRACK 12 ON THE SOUTH END OF PASADENA YARD.  DAMAGE TO THE GATX 89322 ESTIMATED TO BE $12,500 AND DAMAGE TO THE CNW 174542 ESTIMATED TO BE$1500.  THE CREW WAS TESTED FOR REASONABLE CAUSE, AND ALL MEMBERS OF THE CREW TESTED NEGATIVE FOR ALCOHOL AND DRUGS.  THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT WAS:  TRAIN OPEERATION - HUMAN FACTORS; USE OF BRAKES;CAUSE CODE H020; FAILURE TO APPLY SUFFICIENT NUMBER OF HAND BRAKES ON CAR(S) (RAILROAD EMPLOYEE).NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G97509-d-03-03-97-GWWR.Narrative: GATEWAY WESTERN RAOD FREIGHT, 278, WAS PULLING OUT OF TRACK 27 ONTO THE SOUTH LEAD TO SET OUT BAD ORDER CARS. YARD TRAIN Y114 ON TRACK 28 WAS PULLING A CUT OF CARS (40 LOADS AND 21 EMPTIES) UP TO THEWEST END OF THE TRACK. THE CONDUCTOR OF Y114 INSTRUCTED HIS ENGINEER TO REMAIN IN CLEAR OF TRACK 27UNTIL 278 HAD SWITCHED OUT BAD ORDERS AND DEPARTED. AT ABOUT TWENTY FIVE CAR LENGTHS FROM WEST END OF THE TRACK THE ENGINEER SHUT THE THROTTLE OFF AND ALLOWED THE CUT TO DRIFT. AT ABOUT ANOTHER TEN CAR LENGTHS OR SO THE ENGINEER BUNCHED TRAIN WITH INDEPENDENT BRAKE, APPLYING SAND IN PROCESS. AT APPROXIMATELY ANOTHER TEN CAR LENGTHS OR SO THE ENGINEER SET THE INDEPENDENT BRAKE UP COMPLETELY. THE ENGINEER INDICATED THAT HE DIDN'T FEEL THAT THE TRAIN WAS STOPPING PRORPELY SO HE SET ABOUT 15 POUNDSON AUTOMATIC BRAKE TO HELP AND WHEN IT APPEARED THIS WAS WORKING HE PUT THE AUTOMATIC INTO EMERGENCY. HIS TRAIN CONTINUED INTO THE SIDE OF THE SECOND CAR FROM THE REAR END OF 278 RESULTING IN DAMAGESTO THE ENGINE AND TO ADMX 53078. THE ACTUAL CAR REPAIR COST TO THE ADMX CAR WHICH EXCEEDED THE FRA REPORTING THRESHOLD WAS RECEIVED IN THIS OFFICE ON JUNE 30, 1997.NoneNoneNone
